pli-tv-bu-vb-sk10:0.4: The sub-chapter on evenly all around
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk10:0.5: 10. The second training rule on lifted robes
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk10:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk10:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were lifting their robes while sitting in inhabited areas. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk10:1.3.1: “‘I will not lift my robe while sitting in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk10:1.4: One should not lift one’s robe while sitting in an inhabited area.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk10:1.5: If a monk, out of disrespect, lifts his robe on one or both sides while sitting in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk10:1.11: if he has entered his dwelling;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk10:1.14: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk10:1.15: The tenth training rule is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk10:1.16: The first sub-chapter on evenly all around is finished.
